results.question: What is your experience?
results.answer:
The question is a little vague - I'm better with more specific questions, but I'll try my best: I have extensive experience integrating and working with Large Language Models (LLMs) across multiple projects. This hands-on production experience has not only deepened my understanding of LLMs but also allowed me to explore their practical applications in various domains. One of the projects I worked on, moh-ami, involved utilizing LLMs to enhance user interactions and provide intelligent responses in real-time. This project was focused on leveraging the capabilities of LLMs to create a more engaging user experience, demonstrating my ability to apply advanced AI technologies in practical settings.

In addition to my LLM experience, I have been building React applications for over three years, making it my primary framework for frontend development. My journey into development started with a background in fine art, where I honed my creativity and passion for making things. However, I transitioned into technology because I found that I could combine my artistic skills with programming, allowing me to create interactive and visually appealing applications. This unique blend of art and technology informs my approach to development, as I always seek to enhance user experience through design and functionality.

My educational background has been diverse, shaped by my interests rather than a traditional path. This eclectic approach has equipped me with a well-rounded perspective on problem-solving and creativity in technology. My experience with AI and machine learning also spans practical applications, as I focus on building systems that work effectively in production rather than solely pursuing theoretical knowledge.

Overall, my journey from art to technology has enriched my skill set and fueled my passion for developing innovative solutions that leverage cutting-edge technologies like LLMs and React. I am eager to continue exploring the intersection of art and technology in my future projects.

results.question: Tell me about yourself
results.answer:
I am a creative and supportive full stack developer with a passion for building long-lasting production systems. My journey in technology has been fueled by a love for making things and a desire to contribute positively to my team and projects. I worked at Nurtur for three and a half years, where I focused on developing robust applications that meet user needs and stand the test of time. Currently, I am engaged with the Nexus project, where I utilize my skills to create innovative solutions that enhance user experience and streamline processes.

What sets me apart is not just my coding abilities but also the breadth of perspectives I bring from various facets of my life, including art, teaching, and kayaking. These experiences have fostered a unique approach to problem-solving, allowing me to think outside the box and offer creative solutions that resonate with both technical and non-technical team members. I believe that my diverse background enables me to connect with colleagues on a deeper level, fostering collaboration and a sense of community within the workplace.

Looking ahead, my five-year professional vision is to be the go-to person for answers and advice on projects within my team. I aspire to be seen as a valuable resource, someone who not only excels in their technical abilities but also supports others in their growth and development. My core values of Wonder and Connection guide me in this journey, as I strive to cultivate a work environment where curiosity is encouraged, and relationships are nurtured.

In summary, I am driven by creativity and supportiveness, both of which are essential in my work as a developer. I aim to create meaningful connections with my colleagues and contribute to a positive and productive work culture while continually growing in my profession.

results.question: What is your current employment status?
results.answer:
The question is a little vague - I'm better with more specific questions, but I'll try my best:

I worked at Nurtur for 3.5 years, from July 2022 until February 2026, when I was made redundant. During my time there, I held the position of Full Stack Developer, where I focused primarily on React and TypeScript development. My role involved building and maintaining internal dashboards and production systems that are designed to last for years. I was actively engaged in the Nexus project, which allowed me to leverage my skills in both front-end and back-end development, ensuring a robust user experience and efficient data management.

While the redundancy was not my choice, it aligns with my long-term career goals, and I view this transition as an opportunity to pursue new challenges and further develop my professional skills. I am currently navigating the redundancy process, which includes a notice period, and I am committed to ensuring a smooth transition for my team and the projects I was involved in. I believe that my experience at Nurtur has prepared me well for the next stage of my career, where I can apply the knowledge and skills I have gained in a new environment. 

If you would like to know more about my experiences or specific projects I worked on during my time at Nurtur, feel free to ask!

results.answer:
The question is a little vague - I'm better with more specific questions, but I'll try my best: I worked at Nurtur for 3.5 years, from July 2022 until February 2026, when I was made redundant. At Nurtur, I thrived in a collaborative environment, which is something I value greatly in my work life. I believe that small teams, typically consisting of 3-4 motivated individuals, are the most effective for fostering genuine collaboration and innovation. Creativity and supportiveness are at the core of my personality and work style.
